Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: outidej
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after reading the reviews here, despite nervousness that it was too good to be true. It absolutely lived up to my expectations, and have already booked another night with my wife, who can be discriminating. I'm certain it will live up to her standards. No, this is no four-star hotel. It's actually, as has been mentioned here, a motel, though there are indoor hallways unlike most motels. It's a simple, clean room in an incredible location, and there is free parking. The price is considerably cheaper than nearby options. As long as this place keeps up its cleanliness, I can"t ever see paying big bucks to stay at other nearby hotels which may be nicer, but are so much more expensive again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good ubication! Just it.”
Reviews.Author: AlbertoeIsabelle
Reviews.Content: Wifi never work! The air conditioning was very noisy. The place is near to the restaurant zone. Very big mc Donald in front of the Hotel. Definitely I aprove this place to see without problems Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: midnightpi41
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in a King Room here. I git a good deal through BookIt.com and I couldn't have been happier with the value I got out of this visit. The staff was nice and friendly. Parking is FREE!! Great location to everything. The only complaint is they didn't have very thick sheets for the bed, so it was a little cold at night.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal for the Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: AnaMKE
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the room and the 24 service they had. I think this is a great deal, if you're on the budget, and need mainly sleeping amenities. The parking is free, and the lot is fenced. We walked everywhere, to the Hancock and the Navy Pier. Kids had a blast for Breakfast at the next door McDonalds - which is the cleanest, and the best one I've ever been to - with the museum and interactive stuff they have. The 24 hrs Walgreens, two blocks down, was also very useful. This location is great, the kids were so excited to be in the middle of everything. In spite of the winter weather it was easy to have them walking around. There was an attraction on each block they walked on, like Rainforest Cafe, or the Portillo's and Barnelli's restaurant. The purpose for our Chicago visit was to visit the downtown and the Museums, and this Hotel was awesome for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Place to GO!!”
Reviews.Author: stephenie H
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there This weekend....If u want good service ohio house is not the place to go my husband stood outside in 35 degree wheather waiting to get service there was noone at front desk for atleast 5hours but their suppose to be open 24hours, for anyone who dont know chicago is very cold at this time of year, we vacate here every year but you have got to believe we will not be back next year..

Reviews.Title: “vacation”
Reviews.Author: shahpour t
Reviews.Content: nice little hotel , best location. rooms are little outdated but for the price, you can't beat it. close to most attractions and very reasonable. Only thing, the internet signal very weak. After connectiong to internet, you would loose signal in minute or so. but as far as rest. good , cheap place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Skeptical and satisfied”
Reviews.Author: PHXTrainer
Reviews.Content: I was extremely skeptical staying here, The price seemed too good to be true. Upon arrival I was none too impressed with the courteousness of the staff as they were very curt and short. There was free parking available which started me to being warmed up. The room was semi large, about as big as I have gotten in downtown Chicago for twice the price, and the bathroom was the same. They have recently remodeled which was basically new carpet, paint and wallpaper. The furnishings are hysterically old as evidenced by the nightstand which at one time was a two way radio to the front desk and a "magic fingers" massage control. Also, the bathroom fixtures were rusted and decayed like a wrecked ships hull. That being said, the bed was super comfy (free of bed bugs too as I always check), I felt safe in the room and I slept well. The linens are sub par but adequate and the room was adequately clean. There were a few drunks yelling at 4am and some other noise from the street but really, for what we paid in this area I was very pleased. We felt safe, it was clean and the bed was comfy. I often travel on the cheap as I rarely spend much time in the room. I would stay here again. If you require an upscale hotel dont stay here. If you only need a clean safe place to stay and a reasonable rate go ahead. I will stay here again knowing what to expect. Word of caution, there is no AC, if its warm it could be a problem. The room was extremely warm in October without the heat on. The price is right and its not a flea bag Motel, although it gives that impression at first.

Reviews.Title: “You will not find better in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Neal P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here whilst participating in the marathon, my first time in Chicago and picked this motel after reading the earlier reviews. All I can say is you will not find a cleaner, cheaper and more charming motel in Chicago. The price was exceptional when you take into account the location and free parking. The reception staff could not have been more helpful, the attached diner served good and reasonably priced food and the rooms had everything you needed for a short break. Yes, there are better hotels in the city but you will pay for them and if you are looking for a safe affordable room to sleep after a day of sightseeing or shopping I cannot recommend the Ohio House Motel enough. I would pick this place every time I returned to the city..

Reviews.Title: “Good location, FREE parking!”
Reviews.Author: MsBellarosa
Reviews.Content: The hotel really is a motel (as the name indicate). Itâ€™s a two story building with a parking lot an a small reception/office. But the rooms are clean and comfortable and its close to "everything" (Magnificent mile, lots of restaurants, the CTA etc.). I stayed for a couple of night i single queen room and then in a double king room. The latter had a coffee maker and a micro wave. No fridge in the rooms but apparently there is a ice machine in the reception(?). The free parking is a barging if you come by car (an it's fairly easy to get to the hotel). The Ohio House Coffe shop is right on the corner, but I preffered other places for breakfest like Eggsperince (Ontario and Dearborne) or Tempo Cafe (Chestnut and State).

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kat S
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, affordable rates, free parking. My only complaint was that the rooms were very stuffy to the point of being uncomfortable. I can't imagine staying there in the summer. The staff informed my that they are starting to install air conditioning for the rooms. I would stay here again, but would bring a fan next time. Can't beat the price. The beds were comfortable and rather than a bed spread, there was a nice clean sheet on top of the blanket. The connected dinerlike resaurant was so perfect to take our little ones into. Kathy and Carlos (server and cook) couln't have been nicer. The food was good and inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, basic and clean room.”
Reviews.Author: AZU77
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in downtown, on walking distance from the typical Chicago pizza places (Uno + the others) and the metro red line. Ideal to visit the city for a weekend deal. Good price for american standards (still more expensive than in Europe), but very good deal. We got some noise from La Salle av. the first night but surprisingly calm in the second and third night for being in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: skdickson
Reviews.Content: Very cheap, right in the heart of Chicago. Walls are a little thin, but who cares? Nice little greasy spoon attached.

Reviews.Title: “Simple & almost retro cool!”
Reviews.Author: MikeMoAtl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here when every hotel in Chicago was full. I had very low expectations, and they were greatly exceeded. You won't find luxury, free breakfast, exercise room or anything else that most chains provide. What you will find is a simple, clean room and decent bed at a bargain rate in a great convenient location. There is even a fantastic authentic retro diner with cheap prices. The staff was great too! Plus, they are renovating, so it might transition from simple/decent to retro/cool!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish value”
Reviews.Author: Rsixtysix
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a 1960s motel then Ohio House is for you. Reasonable rates for an expensive city. Central downtown location, tho some might find corner location noisy. Clean rooms. Comfortable beds. Breakfast not included. Poor wifi. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Motel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ruatha24
Reviews.Content: We paid $119 + taxes for a total of $137 and visited Chicago on a really busy weekend this year. The Ohio House Motel is a small building in between lots of big ones and we almost missed it, but overall had a pleasant experience. I think people should remember that this is a Motel, not a Hotel, and therefore, you are not receiving the same amenities as a regular Hotel since you are paying less. POSITIVE: Staff had turned air conditioner on before we got there, nice and cool Very clean, both bedroom and bathroom Nice front office staff - quickly able to answer questions FREE parking! Free wi-fi Location is great NEGATIVE: No hair dryers in room. When asked, they only have four you can "borrow" from the front desk. Remember though, this is a Motel. No coffee maker - see above statement. Poor view from window - it was a dark alley Parking is limited to only one car per reservation when full, which is was. Overall, for the price, I was happy with the room and would return here. We were planning on being OUT in Chicago, not staying in our rooms, so this was a perfect fit. It's got a great location I think, very very close to the Rainforest Cafe, Hard Rock Cafe, Gino's East Pizza (amazing deep dish) and American's largest McDonald's. We ended up walking to Grant/Millennium Park and it only took about 30 minutes (plus of which we were looking at shops on Michigan Ave), plus it's very close to the Blue Line Free Summer Trolley that gets you to Navy Pier. The red line trolley also meets up there too, so you don't have to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: getawaytorelax
Reviews.Content: I could go on & on about how bad this is..they advertise free parking but do not have enough spots for each room...that's the beginning & just take my word for the rest....DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “A sightseer's delight!”
Reviews.Author: tink1033
Reviews.Content: Literally in the heart of downtown. Minutes from all modes of transportation. A staff that bent over backward to help me out when I needed assistance. A coffee shop/greasy spoon that my husband loved. Plenty of free parking for guests (we never got in the car again since transportation was so easy to come by using the CTI card). Bargain price in what can otherwise be an otherwise pricey city. The CFD makes constant runs, and we were in a major heat wave in Chicago; otherwise, great.

Reviews.Title: “Was great!”
Reviews.Author: amydavidson81
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here last night and rooms are newly renovated and was very clean...we walked everywhere from here! Great price for being in the heart of downtown! & free parking! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Trash”
Reviews.Author: eMiLy025
Reviews.Content: I thought the motel was going to be more on the side of vintage charm, but it's actually more like vintage trash. The room and adjoining bathroom was small, bare, and full of worn out fixtures. The walls are very thin and we could hear the late-night comings and goings (and shouting) of our neighbors and the road noise from the traffic outside. Not all is lost here-nice front desk staff, cheap food at the diner, decently clean rooms and the Red line isn't too far a walk away. The experience wasn't terrible, but we wouldn't stay here, again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Retro Motel”
Reviews.Author: charokitty
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here.Our room was clean and fairly modern.The bathroom was SPOTLESS. The bed was ok,one burn in the blanket from a past smoker althought it was a non smoking room.Older style tv but plenty of channels.We were not in the room much anyway.There is a cute little diner in front of the motel.We did not eat there but my husband got a good cup of coffee to go.We liked the area, plenty of dining options.And the free parking was nice.We will definitely stay here again when we come back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Retro Look Hotel”
Reviews.Author: charokitty
Reviews.Content: We stayed At Ohio House last night and loved it. Our room looked to be recently renovated,nice furnutiure, wallpaper, etc.The room was very clean, bathroom SPOTLESS.We liked how we could park right outside in front of the stairwell that our room was located.Excellent location, with plenty of dining options and a 24 hour Walgreens near by.There is a cute little diner that's part of the hotel with good coffee. The mattress was a little uncomfortable, seemed to sag in the middle but it was tolerable.All in all we enjoyed our stay here and will most definitely stay here when we come back to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Inexpensive and a great location”
Reviews.Author: icefoggy
Reviews.Content: I chose the Ohio House based on TripAdvisor reviews, and found exactly what I had been expecting. The room we rented was very clean and not very large (but sufficient). The location and free parking were a plus--as was the free Wi-Fi! We tried the onsite restaurant for breakfast, but were disappointed--the food was kind of greasy and the service was slow.

Reviews.Title: “Would Never stay Again.”
Reviews.Author: TaraPet
Reviews.Content: After scouring the internet for many reviews I finally booked with the Ohio House Motel. I had read decent reviews and gave it a shoot. Let me preface this by stating I am not a picky person. I was aware that this is a cheap motel and I was expecting that. A decent place to sleep with no frills. When we first arrived the woman and the front was very unfriendly. We were the only guests checking in and I felt very uncomfortable. I used to live in Chicago and felt it was a poor representation of a friendly city. We checked in on a Wednesday when the motel was not filled up yet. We were put in a room directly facing a ally, kitty corner to the street. It was in the F building, I HIGHLY recommend not staying there. LOUD. Everynight it sounds like there is a party in your room just from people outside walking to and from the bars. What was worst though was our door had gaps in in from being so old we could hear all our adjacent neighbors going about their night and day. They sounded like they were inside our room with us. The maids would come early every morning and yell back and forth to each other while they worked in different rooms. If we wanted to sleep past 9am it wasn't going to happen. The plumbing is poor but that wasn't a huge issue for me knowing the hotel is older. Our television constantly went in and out which wasn't fun trying to watch basketball. The bed was uncomfortable and sank in the middle. I woke up one night thinking the bed and suck to the floor. My BIGGEST ISSUE was what the last person who left a review said, lack of AIR CONTIONING. We stayed at this motel 4 nights. The first night was hot so we had our air on. We left the air on the next day while walking around the city and came back to our vents pumping heat into our room. It was a sauna. We went to the front desk and they told us because it was getting chillier in the city that they turned off the air and had turned on the heat. We were told there are NO INDIVIDUAL controls to your air or heat in your room. They make that decision. I would have NEVER booked with this motel if I would have known that. Basically we did not sleep while we stayed there. When I stated my frustrations to the front desk attendant, she looked at me like I was crazy and never once offered an apology. Rudest staff I have ever encountered. A very depressing place. For a person who really cannot afford over $100 a night in this economy if I could do it all over again I would book far ahead of time and save up more. There is only one map of the city and the staff is not there to help you get around. Be prepared to do it on your own. On a positive note we did eat every morning at the Ohio House Diner attached and it was great. They have good french toast and yummy banana pancakes. Fast and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “My Only Bad Experience of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jawad_ahmad
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Chicago from UK for the first time. The booking was made 6 weeks prior to my stay and I specifically asked for a non-smoking room, and the first thing I was offered was a stinking smoking room! The major attraction for me in this hotel was the free wi-fi, and it did not work at all, apart from outside the building, I was told that hotel is very busy and that is why wi-fi signals are weak, but signals did not improve during any of the five days I stayed there. The room was either too hot or too cold, as air-conditioning was not working. The reception was un-helpful, non- friendly and ......snappy! There was some work going on in the building, and there was lots of noise just outside the window early in the morning, and guests were not warned of that. The motel is located on a busy cross-road and you can easily hear traffic and sirens during the night, a nightmare for light sleepers. It was a busy weekend in Chicago and I could not find a reasonable alternative, otherwise would have left the first night. Overall, my only bad experience of the beautiful Chicago was Ohio House Motel.

Reviews.Title: “Take your own towels with u!”
Reviews.Author: tatjanaz
Reviews.Content: No good for fans of hygiene, I wished I had taken towels with me etc. The doors do not make u feel, your staff would not be stolen within minutes, internet is only working in the rooms, which are in front of the house, not in the backyard rooms, it is possible to find something better and cleaner for acceptable price

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Perfect Locale”
Reviews.Author: urbanpeep
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here while in town for a conference and extended sight seeing trip. The location was within walking distance from the train and plenty of restaurants around it. Including the cute little diner, which is a part of the property. There was a fabulous pizza place nearby and Japanese restaurant right around the corner. Not to mention the famous R Kelly McDonalds across from it... lol. Listen this is a basic motel located a stones throw from way more expensive places. When I come to places like this, its not to stay in the room all day. I'm out exploring and enjoying the city. Plus its better than handing over your money to some faceless corporate chain. Enjoy your stay, I know I did. : )

Reviews.Title: “Free Parking!!”
Reviews.Author: Allen60
Reviews.Content: Besides the huge advantage of free parking in downtown Chicago, this is a great deal. This hotel is a newly-renovated economy motel; nothing more. Expecting anymore is unrealistic. Secondly, the location is perhaps the best in downtown Chicago. Walking distance to everything. It is what it is. It has improved greatly from what it used to be. Disregard the negative reviews; they obviously had unrealistic expectations, but of course had no problem paying the low price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - No Expectation”
Reviews.Author: Pvanderpoel
Reviews.Content: The Ohio House Motel is probably the cheapest place to stay in downtown Chicago. Expect little. Sleep OK. Not a place to work, relax and spend a full working week. A single night, in and out is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Right rate and right location”
Reviews.Author: pratian
Reviews.Content: We didn't interact with the staff much. The housekeepers did a fantastic job with the room. The best service we received was from the lady at the desk during check out. The room was no more than we needed: a bed and a bathroom and a television. We could have used a refrigerator for some leftover food but this wasn't a big deal to us. I can't say enough about the location for the price, within walking distance (if you like walking) of the Loop and Michigan Avenue, CMA stations and water taxis. The backside of the motel faces a parking lot and a nightclub across the street. The nightclub was pretty noisy on Saturday night. The free wi-fi was a nice amenity though we didn't get a strong enough signal to connect from our room.

Reviews.Title: “we were happy”
Reviews.Author: blavine
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. The first night, our room had a noisy (understatement) air conditioner. We asked for a different room, and got F123, which was perfect in all respects. The WiFi was OK (also free WiFi in the nearby McDonalds) and the Coffee Shop very good and cheap. It's the location, though. Lots of nearby restaurants, fancy (Frontera Grill) to casual (Al's Italian Beef), and a short walk to either Michigan Ave or the river and the Clark/Lake EL station. The Hop On/Hop Off trolley has a stop one block away, which was fabulously convenient. Both the Day and Night staff were accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Getaway Central”
Reviews.Author: Jossex
Reviews.Content: The best things about the Ohio House Motel are its location and its price. It was easy to get anywhere from there and the parking was included in the very low rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Salaman
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I were in Chicago mainly to see the Cubs and the Bears . The motel is divided into 6 pods, A to F,, each pod containing 6 separate rooms. This is great for security because the door leading into the pod is locked, and of course each individual room is also locked. Make sure you have at least one meal at the motel's restaurant...excellent breakfast. When we ate there, a chicago cop was enjoying his bacon and eggs. It's a neat little place with a great throwback atmosphere. Parking is free at the motel although there are a limited number of spaces. A couple of excellent eating spots within walking distance are Fado Irish Pub and a great Italian spot called Manngio's. 7 minute walk to the subway station on Grand ( Red Line )...perfect for Wrigley or Soldier Field.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific value in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: iafamilytravel
Reviews.Content: Last fall when we where in Chicago we did Priceline and ended up at The Drake. This is NOT The Drake. But it is a great value in a wonderful location. Our nonsmoking room on the second level was spotless, cool (heat index was 90+) and more than adequate. We could not get an internet signal in our room facing the back. We sat out on the balcony and had fine reception there. We could admire our fine free parking spot which kept my husband smiling through our stay. Every room in Chicago seemed to be booked when we took this last minute getaway, and there were a number of unhappy customers . The hotel had been oversold due to internet problems, but the staff worked to help people to the best of their ability. I would strongly encourage anyone that is on a budget and wants a safe place to stay to head to Ohio HOuse. Enjoy your free parking.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you are paid for”
Reviews.Author: wisconsintraveler101
Reviews.Content: This is really a nightmare! Don't come to this terribly managed, poor service and low quality motel. We arrived at 1pm and was told that we need to come back after 3pm to check in. At 5pm when we came back to check in, we were told that the hotel did not have two-bed room for us, but was available only one-bed room, which was not what we have reserved. What was getting worse was that, the one-bed room assigned to us was a SMOKE ROOM, not the NON-SMOK ROOM we have asked for. With kids, this was extremely hard because the room was small with a small air conditional and it smelled bad. When we confronted the manager on these challenges, they said that there was nothing they could do. The only choice is for them to send us away 45 mins to their sister hotel out of Chicago city. Although the Motel has a free WI-FI, there was absolutely no signal from your room. You will need to come to the manager's office (which is extremely small, by the way) and sit on the stairs to access internet, with your own laptop. Terrible!!!! Don't Come to this Motel!

Reviews.Title: “this was the worst motel i've ever stayed at dirty,old, exspensive,wasn't near the navy pier”
Reviews.Author: marcelespitz
Reviews.Content: worst i have ever stayed at was told it was by navy pier four blocks north but was about two miles .dirty stains on bed sheets .air didn't work in one of our rooms .spiders in both rooms.didn't have our reservations when we got their. over charged us cost 158.00 per room not worth 50.00 don't ever stay at this motel!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, clean, affordable.......”
Reviews.Author: boalex207
Reviews.Content: Clean, retro-style motor lodge convenience to pretty much everything a Chicago tourist would want to see. Very close to dining, shopping, attractions, and transportation. Pedro at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. Larry, the GM, provided me with complimentary post cards and stamps. The room was clean and spacious. Low water pressure in the shower would be my only complaint. We'd stay here again. They offer free parking and an on-site coffee shop, although we did not use those amenities.

Reviews.Title: “HIDDEN GEM!”
Reviews.Author: beber1
Reviews.Content: Our extended family ( we had a total of nine rooms) visited Ohio House for 2 nights to attend our niece's wedding. We all liked the hotel and plan to return. Rooms were clean and nicely furnished. There were just a few minor problems with a television and delayed check-in for one family, but overall I'd give this hotel a great rating. Staff was friendly and helpful, brought extra bedding and pillows when requested. 24 hour staff at desk. My family asked for the mini suite, which is a delightful room over the office. It had a microwave, stove, sink and refrigerator. All rooms had small coffee makers. If you want to be in the center of the action, this is the place. We walked to Navy Pier, the Theatre District, and downtown. We walked along the Chicago River. If you're a light sleeper, bring earplugs because the city never sleeps and busy streets are nearby. Convenient to bus line, just a short 2 block walk to bus #65 that takes you to Navy Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BigIsland1
Reviews.Content: Ohio House is a fixture of Chicago's River North and has one of the best locations in the City in terms of tourist attractions and nightlife. This area of Chicago is open 24 7 and very safe. The hotel is admittedly on the older side, but well kept and free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn' fault it”
Reviews.Author: simonblake
Reviews.Content: This old school motel is in a great location, close to the downtown loop, the pier and if you want to go a little north its perfectly located. Ok the rooms are basic, with a good strong smell of Febreeze to make the place smell ok but its pretty damn clean for what it is. The coffee shop is the best in Chicago for a genuine dinner experience with great food. I would definitely stay here if I came back! The only bad thing is the back rooms face into a lane and the cars that periodically drive down it blow their horn at the end to warn any passing pedestrians, but I bought ear plugs and it was fine. My room was at the very end of the lane so possibly the reason it was the loudest in my room. Stay here and rent a bike and you wont be disapppointed.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Decor”
Reviews.Author: littlepinkalien
Reviews.Content: The rooms here were fairly big and clean enough, the porcelin lamps were an interesting adition. The satff at reception were helpful with any queries that we had. There was noise fro on eof the adjoining rooms till quite late one evening but it was xmas eve! The location was quite central. with in easy walj to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Basic accomodation, free parking, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Beck048
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here last may when we came up to visit our friend in the Navy. It wasnt bad. It was clean and located right in the city (which is excellent for us, as we walk everywhere). It was alittle over priced, but the location was unbeatable and they offered (free!) ample parking. Theres a mcdonalds right next door, an onsite dinner/coffee house, and a great supermarket just around the corner. I'd reccomend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a basic, no frills, place to pass the night.

Reviews.Title: “Smack dab in the middle of it all!”
Reviews.Author: bblover25
Reviews.Content: Not fancy, no frills...just what we needed to be frugal on a room where we spent barely a wink. (Who spends time in your room in Chicago?) Everywhere we went we walked; everywhere was within 15 mins.Desk staff was helpful when asking questions. Perfect for people on a budget, or wanting to spend money elsewhere in the city! Not to mention...FREE parking!

Reviews.Title: “Great Cheap Stay!”
Reviews.Author: dawnmpo
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went to Chicago on whim on the weekend, just to get away from everyday life. We went to the Cultural Center, asked for cheap places to stay in the heart of the city, and this is one of the few options they gave us. We LOVED our stay here. It was simple, cheap, and right next to everything you would need to have fun in Chicago. There was really nothing grand about it, but it's really all you need. Gives you a place to rest your head, park your car, and not have to worry about anything but having fun, which is what we had came to do. Thanks Ohio Motel for making our stay in Chicago that much better! We will defiantly be back!

Reviews.Title: “noisy room and safety concerns”
Reviews.Author: newcastlehost
Reviews.Content: motel with ground and first floor only. I was on the ground floor and discovered during my stay that my bedroom windows were unlocked. As a solo female traveller this was not comforting to me neither were the two locks and a chain on my door. I slept very little due to feeling unsafe and due to what sounded like a generator /machinery which i think was just under my room. This continued all night . They were unable to move me elsewhere. I was please to leave and I would not hurry back. Cheap compared to many other hotels etc in the area. May be better for male travellers or groups

Reviews.Title: “A Basic Room at an Awesome Value and Close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: dallasmorning
Reviews.Content: I had read many reviews of this place and had mixed feelings. I booked anyway. I'm so glad I did! The room is an EXCELLENT value when compared to the other hotels. For example, the Best Western across the street was over $270.00 per night. I stayed in room 117 and it cost me with taxes 138.00. The room was very, very clean, but small and very few amenities. The room is only good for bathing, and sleeping which is all I need. I posted some images as well. The hotel is right on the corner of Ohio and N. LaSalle St. Across LaSalle, and down about 1/2 block is an enormous, two story, absolutely incredible, 2-story McDonald (where we had breakfast) and free WiFi, Blues/Jazz Music, a lounge upstairs, and amazing views. The McD's is open 24 hours which seemed to cause problems for some but the McD is so far away, across a major 4 lane street, and about 1/2 way down the block and surrounded by trees it never bothered me. You gotta visit this place even if it's just for a cup of coffee -- well worh the visit. Across the street - the photo I show is out my room window, is a restaurant/bar. Some folks on this forum complained about noise but I experienced NONE. Maybe if your from Kansas and you are used to absolute quite it might be somewhat noisy but I heard nothing and I live in wooden suburbia. Absolutely no noise at all. Check out the room images. Like I said, it's just for sleeping, but extremely clean I must say. The bed was kinda not soft, hard to explain but for me not a problem. Check out the images and feel free to contact me. Oh, if you go, about two blocks away is Gino's Deep Dish Pizza - a Chicago Original since 1966. The front desk recommended them and I'm so glad I went! Absolutely delicious and plenty of food.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage jem in the heart of the windy city”
Reviews.Author: PugDanelover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ohio House Motel in May when we met friends in Chicago for a Cubs game and mini college reunion. In many ways you get what you pay for at the Ohio House, it's clean, and basic. The towels are somewhat scratchy, and the furnishings somewhat dated, though I prefer to think of them as vintage. Staying at the Ohio House is a little like stepping back in time to the days when families traveled down Route 66 for vacations. That said, you wont find a better deal in downtown Chicago. The parking is free, and that was a huge plus for my husband and I as parking in the city can be very expensive. The staff is very helpful, and the restaurant has an amazing (and cheap!) breakfast, that really hits the spot after a long night out.

Reviews.Title: “Cheapest I could find in the city. Free parking and good location.”
Reviews.Author: mwc79
Reviews.Content: Good enough for what I needed. I didn't want anything fancy and overpriced. Stayed 7 nights with no problems. Not the greatest but it was fine, and I never saw any bugs. The people on the streets and car horns can get annoying though.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you need if you're staying downtown”
Reviews.Author: TripsAbroad84
Reviews.Content: We had tickets to House of Blues one night and instead of paying too much for something we really didn't need we found this place. Honestly if you're staying directly downtown Chi-town what do you really need besides a bed and free parking. Room was in good shape, pretty much just a bed and dresser. Bathroom apparently was clean enough because one of the friends we went with got drunk and passed out while bathing.All in all good little find, everything downtown is in walking distance. Make sure you go walk downtown late at night and watch rats the size of dogs play in the street.

Reviews.Title: “Bug!!”
Reviews.Author: Jasterock
Reviews.Content: Good location. Room is small. You gotta pay for internet access. The worst is i got bitten by bed bugs!!! Will never go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Flea Bag motel”
Reviews.Author: mezna
Reviews.Content: Oh geez, where do I begin ? The only good thing I can say is Great location. This place was the worst in every other way. First off the furnishings are literally garbage . The table lamp in our room had black electrical tape wrapped around the center . The box springs have springs protruding and stains all over them.Some kind of red stain on the carpet,the wallpaper is coming off the wall. If that wasnt bad enough the people in the room next door were animals and fought and screamed all night untill 3 in the morning.Of course I wasnt going to sleep anyway,the bed was ready for the junk heap . I expected this place to be clean and maybe a little dated from the reviews I had read BUT ITS MUCH WORSE THAN THAT . Folks its not worth the few bucks you save . Go to priceline and get a room at the Hilton for about $35.00 more. This place was a DUMP ! ! !

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: 3girlsinthecity
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this motel with 2 other girlfriends and we loved it. When we first pulled up we were a little nervous about it. Before we went in we called the Best Western across the street and they were $180 where the Ohio House was $120 and it didn't really look any better then the Ohio House. We ran into a few ladies just leaving their rooms and they told us to stay because the rooms were good and clean. They even let us in to look and we were happy with them. We stayed for a weekend and were so happy we stayed there. The rooms are not fancy but they were clean and I can't say enough about the location it is close to Michigan Ave only about 5 blocks a quick 5-10 minute walk and one of the train stations is over one street on Grand, very close. Other friends with us had booked on Michigan ave at the Congress and it was way down on S Michigan, a very long walk, and about $100 more. The beds were great and the shower was nice and hot. There is a sports bar across the street and it was a little loud on Friday and Saturday night around 2-3 am although only one friend was awakenend by the noise where the other two of us slept fine and didn't hear a thing. She said it wasn't all that loud and she was able to get right back to sleep. Not a big deal because you are in heart of the city so you hear horns and such anyway. Believe me when you're in the city I don't know why you'd waste lots of money paying for a room that you're only going to be in to change, shower and sleep, there's too much to see and do for hanging in a motel room. Anyway the staff was great. We couldn't ask for anything better, they were very friendly and nice. One night at 12am we couldn't get the cable to work and the older night deskman came up to get it working for us, super nice man. We were really happy with the way you enter your rooms too. There is different sections A, B, C, etc and you have to use your key to enter into the hallway then there's a downstairs with 4 rooms and an upstairs with 4 rooms so it's great cause it's really safe and the doors to your rooms are not opening to the outside like the pictures on the wewbsite look like. It's worth it to stay here because of the location and price. We are definitely staying here when we come back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Cheap, free parking, clean enough.”
Reviews.Author: mcbrumcarr
Reviews.Content: Location is north of the river, great accessibility for all central parts of town. Free parking if your staying, no valet no cost, which is amazing for this location. the cheapest place we stayed. Rooms are basic and wifi costs a little extra. But the rooms are clean enough with some quaint decorative items in the room. Some would call them old, i like to see them as eccetric. if your doing Chicago on a strict budget keep this motel and number in mind. You will save money on the other hotels in central locations. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: alandlea
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous find. We booked on the strength of the reviews on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. This place is a real gem for the budget price. You can't go wrong. We were in the States for 2 weeks and drove from Rochester, MN to Chic. Parking is free and that is a huge bonus in downtown Chic. Loved the location. Everything is within walking distance and there are an abundance of restaurants around. Ask the receptionist to recommend a traditional Chicago pizza place. You won't be disappointed. We were in for a shock. Portions were huge!

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel!”
Reviews.Author: TinaSA78
Reviews.Content: I just can recommend this place! My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights and we had a great time. Nice clean room and a very clean bathroom! Just the nightclub on the otherside of the road was a bit noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest deal”
Reviews.Author: tigerflight
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Ohio House motel twice. I really love this place. It's clean, it's very no-frills, but what do you need? The location is excellent (although surrounded by sports bars, so yes, there are bound to be some yahoos). It has a delightful little wisp of a diner (10 stools and 5 booths maybe?) with excellent french toast. The people who work in the office are very very helpful. I have to say, I might have enjoyed my stay this year a little less than last year- the air conditioning this year didn't seem as magical as last year and they're redoing the rooms and getting rid of the 1960's furniture that I'll admit, I was really charmed by last year. Now it's been replaced by pine boards.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: WantaTellya
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ohio House Motel two times. We thought we had found a reasonably priced clean motel that had free parking and was within walking distance of some nice restaurants and Michigan Avenue. This last time turned out to be filled with problems. #1. On a weekend, the bar across the street is full of drunk people who sit outside in good weather and talk loudly all night (last time I checked was 3 a.m.). It is extremely noisy. #2. The television was stuck on Spanish. After we failed to adjust it, the clerk pulled something on the back to fix it. #3. Right after we paid, the clerk immobilized our room key, so we had to go back to the desk to get our remaining items from the room. #4. BE SURE TO LOOK BEHIND THE CURTAINS AFTER YOU CHECK IN. Make sure the window is locked. Shortly after midnight, I woke with a start to see a HAND REACHING INTO THE ROOM! I screamed and the hand went away. It made me think of the Bates Motel in the movie, Psycho. I can live the rest of my life without ever wanting to repeat that experience! #5. No shampoo or amenities. Flat pillows and very thin sheets. And Clean? Look under the bed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Accomodation in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: sheds29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ohio House last weekend on a three day stay in Chicago. Being a fairly expensive city, budget accomodation was something we needed and the Ohio House provided. The Ohio House is located close to the heart of the city (a few blocks back from Michigan Avenue). The rooms are small to average size; bathrooms average hotel size, with very 60's style appearence and decor. Most people tend to assume that budget accomodation in an expensive city means hygiene problems, however the Ohio House, we found to be, was extremely clean (5 stars in that department). The Motel also has its own small coffee house where we had breakfast on one of our days there. Its was nice, but again very 1960's style which was interesting. Chicago is full of delicious resturants and cafes though - my personal recommendation is a little French style cafe 'Cosi', a block or so back from Michigan Avenue). The Ohio House is also directly across the road from a large McDonald's (not that you'd go all the way to Chicago just to eat McDonald's!) There was only one issue we had with the Ohio House and that was the noise from the streets at night. But the Ohio House is a very clean, comfortable stay for anyone wishing to take a budget holiday in Chicago - which was a beautiful city. Personally, I would stay there again if I was looking for budget accomodation - but should there be available funds, I would probably choose to stay in one of the larger hotels in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: steph_from_oz
Reviews.Content: Ohio House Motel is an inexpensive oasis in the middle of an expensive city. We wanted to stay in the middle of the city, close enough to walk to major attractions, restaurants and bars. Ohio House was perfect for that! Several eateries in the immediate vicinity of Ohio House were great. I sit here drooling over memories of eating Chicago's deep dish pizza as we speak!! Mag mile was an easy 10 minute walk, and we found that we had no problems getting around on foot. The furthest we had to walk was to Soldier Stadium, around 40 minutes away. The accomodation was basic, but clean. it is what it is - a decent motel smack bang in the middle of a big city. House keeping did a really good job each day, and we would look forward to a comfortable bed after a long day exploring a really nice city. We stayed for 7 days, and the only thing I would have liked to have had access to for that period of time was a small refridgerator. Air conditioning worked well, showers were always hot, and for people with a car needing to stay in the city, it is perfect with a parking lot in front of the property. Motel staff were always nice and helpful enough, without being overly friendly or personal. We stayed at this hotel from the 29th June - 7th July 2007, and were able to go to the Taste of Chicago, and experience the 3rd,4th, and 5th of July fireworks. What a great time to visit! A couple of small notes - The rooms are right next to a major street, with an all night mcdonalds next door, and a night club across the road. It didnt really bother us, we had no problems sleeping, but for very light sleepers it may be an issue. People used to large hotels in cities where your room is far from the entrance to the building and any passersby, may not appreciate people being able to walk right by your room on the street.Though with two security locked doors between us and the outside, we never felt unsafe or uneasy at any time. Also, check out the large sports store ( Sports Authority) next door to the motel. With a great bargain basement, and seven stories of sporting goods, my boyfriend was in heaven. I think that people from overseas will especially appreciate the huge store, as I know we dont have anything like it at home! We stayed at this hotel from the 29th June - 7th July 2007, and were able to go to the Taste of Chicago, and experience the 3rd,4th, and 5th of July fireworks. What a great time to visit! All in all I would be happy to stay here again, if we ever get the chance to visit this great city another time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, and cheap, free parking, and clean”
Reviews.Author: cheri8355
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay there the next time we go to Chicago!!! Yes, it's old, and outdated inside, but it is clean, and the rooms are spacious. The location is walking distance to EVERYTHING!!!! We went for the weekend to see the "Jersey Boys" and could even walk to the theatre. We walked to the Mag. mile, the loop, all over...and the parking is free, your car is right there, if you need something from your car, you don't need to find it in a parking garage. Only negative we had, it is noisy at night, you hear everything going on outside, but the bed was comfortable, and we did get enough sleep. Will stay there again. The hotel across the street was double the price. Try it, it's worth it, if you plan on seeing Chicago, and just want to sleep and shower!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Zelda_T
Reviews.Content: What you need to bare in mind about this motel is that you are paying $100 (Â£50) a night to stay in central Chicago. Yes, it is a basic motel but in my experience, it's clean, secure, has cable and it's Â£50 a night! There's a subway station about a 5 minute walk away and the world's biggest McDonalds opposite. Whatever you may think about McDonalds, at least it means taxis know exactly where you're staying! If you're on a budget like we were then it's definitely a place to stay. Try and get a room that faces into the courtyard as the back rooms can be noisy. And if you're in Chicago, take a boat tour , yes it's touristy but you'll get amazing photo opportunities!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and super local!”
Reviews.Author: latinboy1976
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property back in mid July for a couple nights. This trip to Chicago was a bday present to myself but I was on a super tight budget when it came to hotels. I had seen this hotel back in Feb on a previous trip and decided to check it out. Man am I glad I did cause the rates for the rooms are more then worth it. I will admit that the weekend noise from the club across the street can be much and the rooms are in need of some new furnishings but over all the room was clean bed not too bad and those were the two things that I was looking for. Public transport is only a couple blocks away as is Portillos. Next time I am in Chicago and want to stay downtown I will give the hotel another shot just for the price alone.

Reviews.Title: “Average Rooms, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: toni.lister
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed at this motel for 2 nights in June. We found it to be of average quality, but in a good location, close to the city centre & transport. It takes about 40 minutes to get from Chicago-Miday Airport to the motel, via the l-train. There is a car park for guests, & the motel is across the road from the largest McDonald's in the USA. There are many restaurants, clubs & bars in the close vicinity, with the Magnificent Mile & other shopping generally about a 15-minute walk away. The room was fairly spacious but had a funny smell. It was in need of rennovation really, but in general it was definitely passable as a central city motel. The shower was pretty good, with plenty of hot water. There was also HBO, I think. Don't stay here if you are looking for hotel-class accommodation - in the end you get what you pay for, but this motel was satisfactory. We stayed in a room close to the road (the motel is near a large intersection) but weren't too bothered by the traffic noise. There is wi-fi at the motel, & the proprieters let us leave our luggage after check out, which was nice - both the gentlemen we met there were really helpful & friendly. The neighbourhood didn't seem the safest, but it wasn't scary either. The only real downside was the delivery trucks that kept parking in the alleyway next to our room in the early hours of each morning, where they would create quite a racket - it might be better to request a room away from the streets/alleyways if you are a light sleeper. There is no breakfast served here & the cafe on the corner is not really worth it (it's small, dingy & greasy - not in a good way), so save your pennies & venture further afield for something a lot nicer. There is a supermarket not too far away as well, if you are on a budget. And Giordano's deep dish pizza (or Pizzeria Uno, & Gino's) are to die for (& not far away) if you're not worried about your waistline! Overall, this hotel is a little shabby around the edges but is certainly up to scratch value-wise. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best price in town, but expect some discomfort”
Reviews.Author: berndthebread
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel together with my girlfriend during a weekend trip to Chicago. The hotel is probably the cheapest accomendation in downtown Chicago but you have to expect some discomfort when you go there. The room and bed where okay but the windows where pretty thin (compared to the typical situation in Germany) so you hear pretty much everything what's going on outside. Our window was towards the back side of a huge department store and there where noisy fans running all night long. Besides that you hear a lot from the big crossing next to the hotel, and people in Chicago really like to use their horn. On the other side you have free parking and other hotels in downtown are 200 bucks up... Enjoy your stay, Markus

Reviews.Title: “Great locale and good for the price”
Reviews.Author: swinggal
Reviews.Content: What an amazing spot! Chicago was the last stop on a 5 week tour of the US and this motel couldn't have been better located. A little slice of history too and quite adequate for the price. Was clean, safe and central AND had free parking. We ejoyed our stay here. It's not the Ritz but you wouldn't find a better located hostel for that price. I really dont knowwhat some people here are expecting - it's a MOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “another nice stay”
Reviews.Author: michaelvirginiabeach
Reviews.Content: stayed here several times in the past and was in town this weekend (jan 21-23) before going to work in indianapolis for 5 weeks. gotta love the free parking and the close proximity to everything chicago. while it is a motel past its prime, they now have wireless internet in the room. it is loud if you get a room on the side where the main road is; ask for a room on the backside.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: $85/night for a queen room plus free parking in an attached lot is pretty much unheard of anywhere in the city limits of Chicago. So, you have to be a little suspicious going into it. We kept our expectations low and ended up satisfied with what we got. For the price, we knew we weren't going to have lavish decor and plush linens. The rooms are spartan and no-frills, but they are clean and adequately sized. The bathrooms have small bars of soap but no other toiletries, so be prepared and bring your own. If you're a light sleeper, this may not be the place to stay. Street traffic can be heard at all hours, as well as the bass beat of the music playing at the club across the street. We brought a travel fan and it helped drown out a lot of the extraneous noise late at night. For the location and the price, the Ohio House is hard to beat. Just be realistic about your expectations and remember that you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Weird little place with awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: Anilla
Reviews.Content: You'd be surprised to find a place like that downtown Chicago. It has no website and is not featured on Travelocity and the likes (as far as I know). I found it in the Lonely Planet Chicago in the budget section after failing miserably at booking any other place for the Chicago Marathon. Everything was booked 4 months in advanced, except for $400 and up luxury suites. This place still cost $89, which would buy you a decent room on a day other than the day before the Marathon (but I think prices a much lower the rest of the time). Anyway, when it says "Motel", it IS a motel. Straight out of the '50s. It is not just retro-themed, it is truly retro, so if you like that sort of thing, go for it. I still am not completely sure what that gadget that reminded of an old record player/radio (it wasn't a record player) in the corner was, but artifacts like that ceased to exist at least 5 years ago. The place was really worn out, but with a remodeled bathroom. The sheets and blankets must have been on those beds for generations. It was clean, although still looked kind of sketchy, the kind of place that would be featured in the noir film. Customer service was excellent! The gentleman who helped us check in, was one of the most pleasant people I've ever met and that is the reason why I didn't hate the motel. You can't hate a place where such wonderful people work. We also needed some help the next day and the day shift woman was also great. I would recommend this motel for people on a tight budget who don't care for frills.

Reviews.Title: “What Can You Expect”
Reviews.Author: pgbears
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for the weekend to see a Bears game. If you want a fancy hotel then pay the money and stay at one. But if you an ok room at a cheap price, then this it. Area was nice...No problems with the locals. Within walking distance to what downtown Chicago has to offer. Our room was ok..except for the adult magazines and McDonalds garbage that was left in one of the drawers. Their was no bugs and you cant beat the free onsite parking. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory, great price”
Reviews.Author: JohnGibbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in May. Comfortable room, plenty of space, clean, everything worked. No problem with noise at night. Helpful and courteous staff. Would confidently recommend this to any normal tourist. Very good value ' $89 plus tax.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for (Thrifty) Night Owls”
Reviews.Author: booradley2
Reviews.Content: If you have a car and you want to stay downtown, the Ohio House may be the best choice. When you factor in what the other budget hotels charge for parking, the Ohio House is about the cheapest (respectable) lodging place downtown. Plus you can look out your window and actually see your vehicle in the parking lot. I don't like the idea of having my car in a public garage, out of my sight, as is the situation at the other cheap hotels. My only problem with the OH was noise. I stayed in the room above the office---the quietest in the motel---but it was still kind of noisy. Car stereos were the problem---- Ohio & LaSalle is a busy intersection. (The guy who thought of putting subwoofers in car stereos ought to be doing time in prison for crimes against humanity.) The traffic didn't die down until 1:00 am. And I was there on a quiet night---the disco across the street was closed. The room was clean, by the standards of budget motels, and fairly spacious.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After visiting Chicago for the day, we decided to spend the night. After trying to get into several other motels with no luck(no available rooms,needed a credit card)Ohio house gave us a room,a single dirty room with two beds for $130.00. Also if you plan on sleeping, don't forget your ear plugs or you will be sorry!! There is a dance club across the street that closes at 5 am. Also the constant honking of taxi cabs ALL night long was awful. However were grateful we didnt have to sleep in our car.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! You simply won't find a better deal in Chicago. For a very reasonable fare (under $100/night, even with taxes) you get a fantastic location, very safe environment, clean and reasonably sized room, and cheap food at the diner. I was able to walk to the Sears Tower from my room (granted, it was quite a stroll, but still.) and it was pretty accessible to the subway. And the parking is free! I have zero complaints about the Ohio House. None. If I end up back in Chicago it'll be the first place I call... if some chain hasn't tried to put a tower on top of it by then.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there July 20-25 2004, place looks very retro and the little cafe looks like it is out of the 1960's. Rooms clean and spacious, cafe is cheap and standard diner. All major attractions downtown are within walking distance, and the bus to wrigley Field is 2 blocks away, hard rock Cafe 1 block, Spot of Trump's new building is 1 mile or so away. The Rock and roll McDonald's is across street but is being rebuilt and will not open until 2005. Free Trolley to Navy Pier is 2 blocks away. The area is really clean and I did not see any hustlers, hookers or drug dealers. Any other hotel in area starts at $135.00 Great value, great location, I can't believe some chain has not bought this place out. Free parking a plus as some hotels in the area charge for parking in addition to the expensive room. There is no pool but the beach is about two miles away.

Reviews.Title: “It works for me!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Granted, its more quirky than quaint; more plain than plush. But the Ohio House is a great value. The location is awesome, you can't beat the price, you can park right in front of your door, and there are usually rooms available. It may not be grand, but it is clean and I will stay there often!

Reviews.Title: “Super stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the room above the check-in office which has one full wall of window - it was great! Very clean, bright, and comfortable. Nothing fancy-but perfect for the budgeting traveller. Free parking a bonus - and the Ohio Hose cafe had good cheap breakfasts. Will stay here anytime I go to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is hands down the best location in Chicago for the price. It is the only place we stay when we go to Chicago on a budget. The rooms are basic and nothing fancy but have always been clean, especially the bathrooms. We have never been bothered by transients or prostitutes. It is a very busy corner and have always felt sazfe there. Free off-street parking is also a huge plus.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat It...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ohio House back in the '80's' and it was around $50/night so when I wanted to go 6/03 I was afraid of what the pricing would be. I paid $89/night for a busy Chicago weekend...the hotels DIRECTLY across the street and down the block were asking $125+/night. All I did was watch an hour of TV and crashed...took a shower the next morning and left. I can't see paying for a lap of luxury in the hotel when there are so many places and things to do up there! The rooms are clean and unlike Motel 6 you get your choice of shower or bath! I am going to stay at Ohio House anytime I go for more than a one day stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Bed and a Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Auntie_Pooks
Reviews.Content: A very basic, no frills motel with free parking in a lot outside the motel. Very interesting variety of customers. Good & fast food in adjacent coffee shop...if you can find an open seat!!

Reviews.Title: “It's great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay in Chicago for the price. The location on where it is the greatest. It is clean and where else in Chicago has free parking?!

Reviews.Title: “Decent place for a decent price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the Ohio House a few times over the past few years. It's a decent place for a decent price, with free parking. It's pretty clean, and while the furniture isn't brand new, it's really close to all the good spots, and it's on the "good" side of them all. It's a little noisy at night, but HEY - IT'S DOWNTOWN. The blocks on the far side of the motel from Michigan Ave seem a bit dicey, but there's really no reason to go there at night, anyway. I didn't see any hookers there, but to be honest, I wasn't looking, either. If you want the Hilton, then stay at the Hilton. Just get ready to pay $140 or more a night, plus $30 for parking daily. If you want a decent price with a great location, this is a relatively good place. It also has a very convenient little b-fast place that has good (though not too health conscious) food. Enough bang for your buck for my weekend, anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Ohio House”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ohio house while we were on our week long honeymoon. We stayed in one of the suites above the coffee shop. It was VERY clean, and had a kitchenette and everything. We were over joyed with the service, we had the most delicious breakfast everyday at the coffee shop. It's also close to most every attraction in the city. We loved the Ohio House and will stay there every year for our anniversary! P.S. We didn't see any vagrants or prostitutes either!

Reviews.Title: “At least there's no bugs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yeah, it's not the Hyatt, but it's cheap, convenient and there always seems to be rooms here.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Go anywhere else, unless you want to be surrounded by transients and prostitutes.

HotelInfo.Name: Ohio House Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 600 North LaSalle Street, Chicago, IL 60610
